meanings.definition: The belief in or support of established institutions or practices.
meanings.sent1: Her establishmentarianism led her to always follow the rules and traditions.
meanings.sent2: The politician's establishmentarianism made him hesitant to propose any radical changes.
meanings.sent3: His establishmentarianism was so strong that he refused to try the new exotic cuisine.
meanings.sent4: The roots of establishmentarianism run deep in our society, shaping our values and norms.
meanings.sent5: The establishmentarianism of the school board ensured that the curriculum remained unchanged for decades.

meanings.definition: The principles or policies of those who support the existing social, political, or religious order.
meanings.sent1: The group's establishmentarianism was evident in their defense of traditional family values.
meanings.sent2: In times of uncertainty, establishmentarianism can provide a sense of stability.
meanings.sent3: The establishmentarianism of the town council was put to the test when faced with a controversial decision.
meanings.sent4: The artist challenged establishmentarianism by creating provocative and unconventional art.
meanings.sent5: The establishmentarianism of the church elders guided their decisions on matters of doctrine and worship.
